text: Stephanie (which can be spelled in different ways) [ stef-uh-nee ] is a female given name. Stephanie is a name that has been commonly given to girls for hundreds of years. Its origins come from the Greek name Stephanos, which translates to "crown" or "garland." Over time, many well-known individuals have been named Stephanie, contributing to its rich history. The masculine version is Stephen. Stephanie is a very popular female name. Many celebrities and fictional characters carry the name. For example, Stefani Germanotta goes by the stage name Lady Gaga. This name was ranked #455 on the US Popular Names in 2021. == People == * Princess St√©phanie of Monaco, younger daughter of Rainier III, Prince of Monaco, and Grace Kelly; younger sister of Albert II, Prince of Monaco * Stephanie Grisham, Former Trump White House Press Secretary * Stephanie Murphy, U.S. Representative from Florida (born 1978) ==References== Category:Given names
title: Stephanie
